intro: Phanera velutina, commonly known as the velvet phanera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
